Bears Unveil Cutting-Edge Football Field Design for FBS Transition
The Missouri State Bears are launching a new Pivot Performance Turf surface at Robert W. Plaster Stadium in preparation for their entrance into Conference USA and FBS football. The installation process will begin on April 7, following the removal of the existing turf, and is expected to conclude by May 20. The new field design will prominently feature the "MoState" script logo and a tribute to the state of Missouri at its center, setting a modern tone for their upcoming season. The project is budgeted at $1,820,000 and comes with a notable 12-year warranty, showcasing the advanced technology behind this environmentally-friendly turf. The Bears will hold their last event on the old turf during the Maroon and White Spring Game this weekend.
- $1,820,000 allocated for the new field installation.
- 12-year warranty on the Pivot Performance Turf surface.
- Removal of the old turf begins April 7, weather permitting.
- Installation of new turf expected to take approximately six weeks.
- Final event on the old turf is the Maroon and White Spring Game.
The Bears are set to debut their new field design on September 13, 2025, during their home opener against SMU, amidst a season featuring six home games, including four in their inaugural Conference USA schedule.
Bottom LineThe new turf design not only enhances the Bears' home field but also signifies an exciting evolution for Missouri State Football as they transition to higher competition levels in Conference USA.
